purpleculture_pinyin:
yūn
confused; dizzy; giddy; to faint; to swoon; to lose consciousness; to pass out
смущенный; головокружительный; головокружение; упасть в обморок; упасть в обморок; терять сознание; отключиться

yùn
dizzy; halo; ring around moon or sun
головокружительный; гало; кольцо вокруг луны или солнца
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 晕)
Pictophonetic: 軍 indicates the sound; 日 (sun) conveys the meaning.
Antonyms: 醒
purpleculture_examples:
暈頭轉向 [ yūn tóu zhuàn xiàng ]: confused and disoriented
暈厥 [ yūn jué ]: to faint
暈船 [ yùn chuán ]: to become seasick
暈車 [ yùn chē ]: to be carsick
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 日 [ rì ] sun; day; daytime
    • 軍 [ jūn ] army, military; soldiers, troops
heisig_chinese_memo: You roll around on your chariot all day and get dizzy from the hot sun and lack of water. &nbsp
Ru_trainchinese:
yùn: (глаг/сущ) чувствовать головокружение; ореол (вокруг света или цвета); гало (вокруг Солнца или Луны)
yūn: (прил/глаг) испытывающий головокружение; терять сознание, падать в обморок
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the sun (日) makes the army (軍) dizzy
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The sun chariot makes people dizzy when it flashes a beam of light in their eyes as it passes by.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle starts from " Sun ", and the surroundings of " Sun " are from small dots like cloud gas (components are represented by ◎), like the sun around the cloud with condensed form. The original meaning is the aperture around the sun. Later it is also used to indicate the aperture around the moon. It is formed by refraction when sunlight or moonlight illuminates the ice crystals in the clouds. The former is called "solar halo" and the latter is called "moon halo." "Said the text": "Halo, moon gas also from Japan, the military sound.." "Jade articles": "Halo, next to the sun and the moon gas also." Xiaozhuan changed from " day ", " army " also sound, " In addition to the sound symbols, " jun " also serves as an ideographical function. It means that the army is surrounded by soldiers, horses and chariots. It also means surrounding, so it can be used to express the original meaning of surrounding clouds. Clouds around the day are not clear, so it is later used to indicate dizziness, coma and other symptoms, because the vision is also blurred, or even loss of consciousness (see Gu Yankui).

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning, which means that the sky is cloudy and the cloud is obscured by the sun. "Collection" 974: "Ding Mao halo", which means that Ding Mao is cloudy on this day. "Collection" 13049: "You faint, prolong the rain." It means that the clouds cover the sun on this day, and the rain is continuous.

Han silk script uses " jun " to mean " halo ", "Mawangdui. Astronomy Miscellaneous: "Where the army (halo) is, the army is defeated." It means that the sun and the moon are surrounded by clouds and will be defeated. "Mawangdui. "Astronomy Miscellaneous": "Yuejun (halo) pack, can not fight for seven days." It means that the moon is surrounded by clouds, and the war does not exceed seven days.

The original meaning of the word " dizzy " is still retained in later poems. Li Bai's "Hengjiang Ci": "The moon is dizzy and the wind does not open, and the sea whales go back to the river." But it means more dizziness, dizziness, and Lu Guimeng "Feng Chou attack" "One Hundred Rhymes of Wu Zhong Kuyu, the American Predecessor": "Looking at the flower is dizzy, but seeing the wine forgets the lungs and thirst." "The Water Margin" Chapter 36: "(Song Jiang) helped him forward, but he also felt dizzy. Fell to the ground."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle starts from " day ", and the surroundings of " day " are from small dots like cloud gas (components are represented by ◎), like the sun, there is cloud gas condensing shape around it. The original meaning is the aperture around the sun, which is extended to physical symptoms such as dizziness.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「日」，「日」的四周從象雲氣的小點（部件以◎表示），象太陽的周圍有雲氣凝聚之形。本義是太陽周圍的光圈，後也用來表示月亮周圍的光圈，是陽光或月光照射雲層中的冰晶時折射而形成的，前者叫「日暈」，後者叫「月暈」。《說文》：「暈，日月气也。从日，軍聲。」《玉篇》：「暈，日月旁气也。」小篆改為從「日」，「軍」亦聲，「軍」除了是聲符外，還起表意作用，表示軍營兵馬、戰車相圍，也有環繞之意，故可用來表示日旁雲氣環繞的本義。日旁雲氣環繞，看不清晰，故後用來表示頭暈、昏迷等徵狀，因視線同樣模糊不清，甚或失去知覺（參谷衍奎）。

　　甲骨文用作本義，表示陰天、雲氣蔽日，《合集》974：「丁卯暈」，意謂丁卯這一天陰天。《合集》13049：「酉暈，延雨。」意謂酉這一天雲氣蔽日，連綿不斷地下雨。

　　漢帛書假借「軍」來表示「暈」，《馬王堆．天文雜占》：「軍（暈）之所在，軍敗。」意謂日月周圍雲氣環繞，就會戰敗。《馬王堆．天文雜占》：「月軍（暈）包，戰不出七日。」意謂月亮有雲氣包圍，打仗不超過七日。

　　「暈」字的本義仍保留在後世的詩文中，李白〈橫江詞〉：「月暈天風霧不開，海鯨東蹙百川迴。」不過更多表示昏眩、頭暈，陸龜蒙〈奉酬襲美先輩吳中苦雨一百韻〉：「看花雖眼暈，見酒忘肺渴。」《水滸全傳》第三十六回：「（宋江）向前扶他，不覺自家也頭暈眼花，撲地倒了。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「日」，「日」的四周從象雲氣的小點（部件以◎表示），象太陽的周圍有雲氣凝聚之形。本義是太陽周圍的光圈，引申為頭暈等身體徵狀。

Kanshudo mnemonic:the sun (日) makes the army (軍) dizzy
Chinese: You roll around on your chariot all day and get dizzy from the hot sun and lack of water.  
Meaning: dizzy
Hanzi: 晕
Story: The sun chariot makes people dizzy when it flashes a beam of light in their eyes as it passes by.
Kind: traditional

甲骨文從「 日 」，「 日 」的四周從象雲氣的小點（部件以◎表示），象太陽的周圍有雲氣凝聚之形。本義是太陽周圍的光圈，後也用來表示月亮周圍的光圈，是陽光或月光照射雲層中的冰晶時折射而形成的，前者叫「日暈」，後者叫「月暈」。《說文》：「暈，日月气也。从日，軍聲。」《玉篇》：「暈，日月旁气也。」小篆改為從「 日 」，「 軍 」亦聲，「 軍 」除了是聲符外，還起表意作用，表示軍營兵馬、戰車相圍，也有環繞之意，故可用來表示日旁雲氣環繞的本義。日旁雲氣環繞，看不清晰，故後用來表示頭暈、昏迷等徵狀，因視線同樣模糊不清，甚或失去知覺（參谷衍奎）。 甲骨文用作本義，表示陰天、雲氣蔽日，《合集》974：「丁卯暈」，意謂丁卯這一天陰天。《合集》13049：「酉暈，延雨。」意謂酉這一天雲氣蔽日，連綿不斷地下雨。 漢帛書假借「 軍 」來表示「 暈 」，《馬王堆．天文雜占》：「軍（暈）之所在，軍敗。」意謂日月周圍雲氣環繞，就會戰敗。《馬王堆．天文雜占》：「月軍（暈）包，戰不出七日。」意謂月亮有雲氣包圍，打仗不超過七日。 「 暈 」字的本義仍保留在後世的詩文中，李白〈橫江詞〉：「月暈天風霧不開，海鯨東蹙百川迴。」不過更多表示昏眩、頭暈，陸龜蒙〈奉酬襲美先輩吳中苦雨一百韻〉：「看花雖眼暈，見酒忘肺渴。」《水滸全傳》第三十六回：「（宋江）向前扶他，不覺自家也頭暈眼花，撲地倒了。」

It is formed by refraction when sunlight or moonlight illuminates the ice crystals in the clouds. The former is called "solar halo" and the latter is called "moon halo." "Said the text": "Halo, moon gas also from Japan, the military sound.." "Jade articles": "Halo, next to the sun and the moon gas also." Xiaozhuan changed from " day", " army" also sound, " In addition to the sound symbols, " jun" also serves as an ideographical function. It means that the army is surrounded by soldiers, horses and chariots. It also means surrounding, so it can be used to express the original meaning of surrounding clouds. 暈字的基本解释

暈
yùn

暈
yūn
均见“晕”。

暈字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yùn］
［《廣韻》王問切，去問，云。］
“暉2”的被通假字。亦作“煇2”。“晕1”的繁体字。
(1)日月周围的光圈。
(2)环形花纹或波纹。
(3)指靶心。
(4)光影或色彩四周模糊的部分。
(5)指色彩由中心向四周扩散开去。
(6)（或读yūn）视觉模糊；昏眩。
(7)谓涂抹（颜色）。
(8)谓泛起淡红色。
(9)用以形容俊俏。参见“暈龐兒”。
[②]［yūn］
“晕2”的繁体字。
昏迷。参见“暈2厥”、“暈2倒”。

暈字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　暈； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页497第37
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】王問切【正韻】禹慍切，?音運。日旁氣也。【釋名】暈，捲也。氣在外捲結之也，日月俱然。【史記·天官書】兩軍相當，日暈。

暈字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
暈字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yùn］
["Guangyun" Wang Wenqie, go and ask, Yun. ]
"Hui 2" was passed falsely. Also known as "Hui 2". Traditional characters for "Halo 1".
(1) The aperture around the sun and the moon.
(2) Annular pattern or corrugation.
(3) Refers to the bullseye.
(4) The blurred part of light and shadow or color.
(5) Refers to the spread of colors from the center to the surroundings.
(6) (or pronounce yūn) Blurred vision; dizzy.
(7) It is called smear (color).
(8) It is said that it is light red.
(9) Used to describe handsome. See "Halo Panger".
[②]［yūn］
"Halo 2" in traditional characters.
coma. See "fainting 2 syncope", "fainting 2 falling down".
gosh
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji 1] [Japanese Character Department] 　Halo; Kangxi strokes: 13; Page number: page 497 37
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Wang Wenqie [Zheng Yun] Yu Yunqie,? Yinyun. The day is also angry. [Release name] Halo, volume. When the qi is wounded outside, the sun and the moon are unavoidable. 【Historical Records·Book of Heavenly Officials】The two armies are equal, and the sun is dizzy.
